sourceMeaningMnemonic: How do you make a mnemonic for the word this? You don’t. But, we can try. You climb many <radical>hills</radical>. On top of one of the hills is a little <radical>drop</radical> of water. You pick it up and say “<kanji>THIS</kanji>… THIS IS WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR!”
meaningInfo: As you look at the drop of water, you note that you found the right thing. Written on it is the word “this."
readingMnemonic: You <reading>colle</reading>ct(<ja>これ</ja>) <kanji>this</kanji> very carefully. You’re going to add this to your drop collection.
readingInfo: You’re always collecting drops of water in the hills. It’s your hobby, in fact. But this one is the first one you’ve ever collected with “this” written on it. What a great addition to your drop collection.
